meanings.definition: In a false or counterfeit manner
meanings.sent1: She claimed the product worked, but it was bogusly advertised.
meanings.sent2: The seller tried to pass off the fake watch as real, but it was bogusly made.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was revealed when he bogusly made the coin disappear.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist bogusly promised riches to the unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The student tried to pass off the copied work as his own, but the teacher saw through it as bogusly done.

meanings.definition: In a deceptive or fraudulent way
meanings.sent1: The con artist bogusly claimed to be a wealthy businessman.
meanings.sent2: The email promising a free vacation was bogusly sent to trick people.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller bogusly predicted that the customer would win the lottery.
meanings.sent4: The company was accused of bogusly inflating their sales numbers.
meanings.sent5: The politician bogusly promised to lower taxes, but never followed through.
